Gah! Got pulled away @SueDuris. Glad I could join in for #CXChat a bit. Let's find sometime to catch up offline in the next few weeks. :)

A5: I'd improve awareness for what is/isn't #CX. To the earlier point, the lack of clarity only hurts our ability to make progress, and creates misunderstandings for what it can do to help a business succeed and what it matters so darn much! #CXChat
@SueDuris It is an absolute delight to witness the a-ha moments! #CXChat
@thatcxguytweets Definitely important to have an element of levity! One should never take themselves TOO seriously. :) #CXChat

A4: If I were to give myself a #CX superpower, I'd say it's perspective. I use it to help peers, other CX leaders, etc., look up from the part of the experience they own to see how it fits into and affects the bigger picture. Helps with sorting #metrics too! #CXChat
@SueDuris That's it, I'm triggered. :| #CXChat
@SueDuris Indeed! It's great to be here. Hope that all is well with you, Sue! #CXChat

A3: My least favorite part of #cx is the squishiness with which businesses use to define it today. Example, saw a job posting for a CX Supervisor today, leading their team of CX Representatives. It was #ContactCenter #custserv. Lets call things what they are! #cxchat

@SueDuris @thatcxguytweets I remember being focused on the #customerexperience when I was delivering newspapers as a kid. From how they wanted the paper folded to where they wanted it placed. I got my first #cx title in 2009.
A2: What makes #CX my favorite? It requires us to collaborate with others, puts us in a posture to serve, and enables us to improve the lives of others! #cxchat
A1: Oooh! I feel like #CX chose me, more than I it. That said - I remember the moment that I knew it was right for me. #cxchat

A10: Will tech eat up all of the #CustomerService jobs? No. Will it change them drastically? Without a doubt. #custserv
@ImMarkBernhardt @GregOrtbach right on guys. That‚Äôs precisely where even the best deployments can go south fast. #custserv

@MarshaCollier A7: Tech can do a lot of great things for us from automating manual tasks, to curating actionable insights, to recommending ways to improve employee performance. Is it always the thing that will improve your business? Nope. Might it be? You bet. #custserv
A8: It‚Äôs only as good as the people who designed, deployed, and continuously optimize for the business. There‚Äôs a lot of great tech out there that‚Äôs poorly implemented. #custserv
A7: Confession: I‚Äôm not totally clear on the question here. What are we really asking? #custserv
@MarshaCollier Haha, sorry, was tight on characters. ;) #RoboticProcessAutomation & #WorkforceEngagementManagement. #custserv
A6: Live chat, phone, and SMS. Usually in that order. #custserv

A5: I‚Äôve got my eyes on a lot of tech right now‚Ä¶ I see opportunities for #RPA to make some huge efficiency gains, analytic platforms are making big gains on how they‚Äôre curating insights, & love some of the advances with #WEM suites. #custserv
A4: Depends on what IT is. Tech can‚Äôt fix (and actually gets worse) with broken process, but if IT is a lack of aggregated insights and data trends, then possibly!  #custserv

A3: Not yet. I tend to prefer live chat and deflect to phone as needed. I‚Äôve supported customers through messenger, however, and most seemed shocked to see that they got a response there. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è #custserv

A2: Fundamentals are constant and we‚Äôd all be better served by spending a smidge more time focused on delivering against them vs chasing the new shiny objects. Those are great too, if we can first deliver well on the basics. Sadly, many still struggle crossing that bar. #custserv
A1: Improving response time? Sure. Improving resolution rates? Not always. Deflecting from other channels? Sometimes. Like anything, poorly designed tech yields poor outcomes. #CustServ
